column1: From Riviera Maya News on July 30, 2020Quote...The city of Cancun has created a special police unit to deal with non-compliance of Covid-19 health protocols.UnquoteIt will begin operaing on 3 August. Their job is to create awareness about prevention and to monitor the correct application of health protocols.In the instances of non-compliance, fines will be imposed by a judge and in the event that it is not paid, an arrest will be carried out for a maximum of 36 hours.Full report: https:/…2020.html

My understanding is that they will places at various points throughout the city including the hotel zone. Cancun is serious about wearing masks. Yesterday I saw the police confront a group of tourists outside Wal-Mart who were not wearing masks. This is the second time this week I've seen that.
Its amazes me that people are still fighting this. Even if you think its useless, this is a battle you can't win. Just put it on. WHY is this so hard?
It doesn’t mention hotels. That’s unfortunate. It’s clear that resorts need “encouragement” to increase guest compliance in their indoor areas.

Personally, I'm thrilled by this news. CombI drivers have been disregarding the law for many years. They drive way to fast darting in and out of traffic with no regard for the safety of their passengers. There's st least one accident a day here causes by their excessive speed that involved injuries to passengers. They have blatantly disregarded the Covid protocols allowing far more than 8 people in the combi and people without facemadks. It thrills me they are finally being held accountable. They need to learn they are not exempt from the laws.
Yes, it is good.An arrest was also made in Tulum a few days ago. An unmasked person was warned but still refused to wear a mask, so he was arrested.

Joan we spoke about how hot they get and sometimes uncomfortable but being sock would be way more uncomfortable than following the rules set forth. I’m all about it when I’m in Tulum next week.
